definitions: To permit or enable the occurrence of errors, mistakes, or unsuccessful outcomes.
To create an environment or system where it is acceptable for things to go wrong without severe repercussions, often for the purpose of learning or improvement.
examples: We must allow failure in our experiments to discover new solutions.
The new policy will allow failure in early stages of development to foster innovation.
It's important to allow failure in a child's learning process so they can grow.
